messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] (unknown)
messages.msgSnippet: -=-having been in a marriage that was not salvageable, a positive divorce can be better for kids than a toxic marriage.-=- Sure.  If divorce is inevitable,
messages.messageBody:
-=-having been in a marriage that was not salvageable, a positive
divorce can be better for kids than a toxic marriage.-=-

Sure. If divorce is inevitable, then the better the better!

My objection was to people seeming to promise that if people thought
the right thoughts they could manifest an ideal divorce.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.msgSnippet: ... And sometimes, though, even in divorce, parents CAN choose to put the kids first, and unschooling can continue.  We can honor the commitment to our kids,
messages.messageBody:
>>I don't think you can overestimate the importance of that choice.<<


And sometimes, though, even in divorce, parents CAN choose to put the kids first, and unschooling can continue.  We can honor the commitment to our kids, and be thoughtful and respectful of our ex-spouses.  I am not advocating divorce, but having been in a marriage that was not salvageable, a positive divorce can be better for kids than a toxic marriage.

Jay




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
